column4: hey all.. so this morning I hear lots of drive and network activity. I have been trying to figure out what is going on. Network traffic shows several outbdound connections to HTTPS (443). Nothing running such as p2p... anyone have any ideas?
you on a secure site?, also are you watching a video or anything that involves streaming from HDD?
sjm.. did that and can only see system_bus_socket and hald
nothing streaming.
is this from boot?
nope... been up 12 hours.
gimp? anything that caches a lot, long firefox session?
nothing running, but that doesn't mean that ff isn't borked... will check that out.
interesting thing is that the outgoing connections are all to the same subnet.
runnning samba? apache?, anything server like?
the only difference since yesterday is that I am using pidgin for IRC... I am starting to think that maybe that has something to do with it.. but I can't see why it would use traffic on 443.
sjm.. yeah. I normally use xchat.. but I tried pidgin to get everything in one spot... I should know better.
not sure, i'm pretty sure irc is not even secure(as in secure to use 443 anyway, but other messaging protocols use 443)
ok.. this isn't good.. I have 5 outgoing connections on the following ports... 55695, 51147, 55609, 55562, 43749 etc... all to a block of IP's owned by Micro$oft.
using msn?
thanks for your help... for some reason... pidgin was swallowing its own face over connecting to WLM over https. I have killed it, and it stopped.
ok, good, nice that you found that out :)
you suggest something better to connect to msn? pidgin seems bloated
not sure, when i use pidgin, i'm only ever on for about 5-10mins. there is finch and bitlbee if you like cli
empathy, maybe
ok.. thanks for all your help. I really appreciate it.
your welcome
